newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - ConAgra buy repeated.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - ConAgra buy repeated.

text.p: -- Goldman Sachs analyst Nomi Ghez said Thursday she reiterated her buy rating on diversified food company ConAgra Inc, and raised her fiscal 1997 estimate by $0.01 a share to $2.68. Her fiscal 1998 estimate remains $3.05 a share.
-- Earlier, ConAgra reported third quarter earnings of $0.63 a share, in line with the First Call mean estimate, up from $0.55 a year ago.
-- Earnings were helped by a 11.3 percent decline in interest expense, while operating income was up about 6.5 percent.

-- Ghez said the interest expense was lower due to ConAgra's sale last year of 50 percent of its worldwide barley malting business. That sale also contributed to a drop in sales and trimmed the rise in operating income.
-- "I think with ConAgra, you have to look at the bottom line and that bottom line was good and in line (with estimates)," Ghez said.
-- She added that the refrigerated foods segment posted a 35 percent rise in operating profit in the third quarter, which reflected a turn around in some of ConAgra's fresh meat operations.
